greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ballot sequences of length n having 3 largest parts.
comment: Also number of standard Young tableaux with last row of length 3.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..100
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = If[n < 1, x^l[[-1]], b[n - 1, Append[l, 1]] + Sum[If[i == 1 || l[[i - 1]] > l[[i]], b[n - 1, ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]] + 1]], 0], {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; a[n_] := Coefficient[b[n - 1, {1}], x, 3]; Table[a[n], {n, 3, 30}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 10 2015, after A238123 *)
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 20 2014
